title: How to Annotate Your Images Using KPhotoAlbum

steps.headline: When starting it up for the first time, you need to set up a location for it to look for the images.
Wait for a bit.
steps.description: The program will need to catalog the images before you do anything with them.

steps.headline: Click on the Show Thumbnails icon.
steps.description: If you can't see it, your screen isn't large enough. Enlarge it or scroll down.

steps.headline: Set the label.
steps.description: This one is probably best saved for doing individual or groups of photos. Like if some of the images are all about caving, label those images as such.

steps.headline: If you aren't sure of the contents of an image, double click on the image to get a closer look at it.

text: Start up the software. It is a Linux product. When starting it up for the first time, you need to set up a location for it to look for the images. KPhotoAlbum will remember it. Wait for a bit. The program will need to catalog the images before you do anything with them. Click on the Show Thumbnails icon. If you can't see it, your screen isn't large enough. Enlarge it or scroll down. Set the label. This one is probably best saved for doing individual or groups of photos. Like if some of the images are all about caving, label those images as such. If you aren't sure of the contents of an image, double click on the image to get a closer look at it.
